title: Young's modulus
summary: Young's modulus E {\displaystyle E} , the Young modulus, or the modulus of elasticity in tension or compression (i.e., negative tension), is a mechanical property that measures the tensile or compressive stiffness of a solid material when the force is applied lengthwise. It quantifies the relationship between tensile/compressive stress σ {\displaystyle \sigma } (force per unit area) and axial strain ε {\displaystyle \varepsilon } (proportional deformation) in the linear elastic region of a material and is determined using the formula:[1]
